availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joshua Craig (Bath County, KY, farmer and shoe maker)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Rebecca Warren Craig in Bath County in March 1839. Father of Mary Craig, Ann E. Craig, William L. Craig, Martha J. Craig, Sarah Craig, Abigail Craig, Nannie Craig, James Craig, Emily Craig, Maranda Craig, Ann E. Craig, and Thomas Craig. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Shoe maker in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 79A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 38.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Sharpsburg, p. 97A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273004, p. 235.
